Key Arguments: The submission argues that the government is the main source of misinformation and disinformation.
It questions the government's ability to define truth and suggests that censorship is anti-democratic.
The submission claims that the government's response to COVID-19 was based on misinformation.
It argues that the proposed legislation would suppress political diversity and free speech.
The submission suggests that the 2020 US election was manipulated and that similar issues could affect Australian elections.
Main Themes: Government as a source of misinformation
Censorship and its impact on democracy
Notable Quotes: Unfortunately, over the last three years Western governments have provided irrefutable evidence demonstrating that they indeed are the most guilty of peddling misinformation and disinformation.
This leads to a rank and dangerous hypocrisy.
The Federal Government shows no competency or credibility in dealing with the very concept of truth.
Political censorship spells the end of democracy.
